intro: Dibothrospermum agreste, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, kidney-shaped berries. Its roots and stems are traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties. The botanical features of Dibothrospermum agreste make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
